intro: Erythranthe inamoena, commonly known as the pink sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its striking pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun, making it well adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs, and the stems are erect and branched. Erythranthe inamoena is often found in coastal dunes and dry slopes, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local wildlife.
